seng202.crimeSpy.crimeData

Class CrimeType

  • java.lang.Object
    • seng202.crimeSpy.crimeData.CrimeType

  • public class CrimeType
extends java.lang.Object
    CrimeType object abstracts information about a crime (it's type)

    Validation is performed at the getter setter level. All constructors should implement a getter or setter to ensure consistent validation. (don't use this.value = value;)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CrimeType(java.lang.String iucr)
      Constructor for CrimeType object takes the two code descriptions of a crime (iucr (Integer) and a two part textual description of the crime type.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CrimeType

        public CrimeType(java.lang.String iucr)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructor for CrimeType object takes the two code descriptions of a crime (iucr (Integer) and a two part textual description of the crime type.

        For example
        CrimeType crimeTYP = new CrimeType(460);
        CrimeType crimeTYP = new CrimeType(430);

        Parameters:
        iucr - Illinois Uniform Crime Reporting code (Alphanumeric and min of 2 chars)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    • Method Detail

      • getTypesOfCrimes

        public static java.lang.String[] getTypesOfCrimes()

      • addTypesOfCrimes

        public static void addTypesOfCrimes()

      • validateIcur

        public boolean validateIcur(java.lang.String icurStr)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Check the validity of the iucr code for the crime type.

        The ICUR code is used in database storage as a primary key. This field can therefore not be null and in fact must be unique

        An iucr code should be alphanumeric, not null and not empty. Additionally this code assumes that the code should be at least 3 characters in length.

        See also here

        Parameters:
        icurStr - intended iucr code
        Returns:
        true iff the string matches the pattern of a valid iucr code. false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • capitaliseIcur

        public void capitaliseIcur(java.lang.String icurStr)

        Change any occurrences of lower case letters to upper case for the ICUR code

        See also here

        Parameters:
        icurStr - iucr code

      • setCrimeType

        public void setCrimeType(java.lang.String icur)

        This function can be used instead of the individual setters.
        Parameters:

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getIucr

        public java.lang.String getIucr()
        Gets case iucr: Illinois Uniform Crime Reporting code
        Returns:
        A String of the case identifier (should be alphanumeric only)

      • setIucr

        public void setIucr(java.lang.String iucr)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set case iucr: Illinois Uniform Crime Reporting code Validation checks are performed (length and format)
        Parameters:
        iucr - typically (though not always) 4 chars and is alphanumeric
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getPrimaryDescription

        public java.lang.String getPrimaryDescription()
        Gets textual description of crime (crime category based on the IUCR)
        Returns:
        A String that describes the crime. eg: "THEFT"

      • setPrimaryDescription
